ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: No wonder you are surprised as they laugh with scorn!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Yet while you are filled with wonder, they just scoff;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: You marvel (at the wondrous creations of Allah) and they scoff at it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), you will be surprised that they still mock (God's revelations).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Rather you are surprised, whereas they keep mocking.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay, you wondered while they mock.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay! you wonder while they mock,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Nay, thou marvellest; and they scoff
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but thou dost marvel when they mock
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: No wonder you are surprised as they laugh with scorn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Aye! thou marvellest, and they scoff.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed you wonder, while they engage in ridicule,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Truly dost thou marvel, while they ridicule,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, you (O Muhammad SAW) wondered (at their insolence) while they mock (at you and at the Quran).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: No, you marvel, while they scoff.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But you wonder, and they ridicule.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But you wonder, while they mock,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:12] Nay, but (bal is for effecting a transition from one object to another, which in this case is to inform of his state and theirs) you marvel, (‘ajibta) addressing the Prophet (s), that is, [you marvel] that they deny you, while they engage in ridicule, at your marvelling,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, but thou dost) Muhammad (marvel) their denial of you (when they mock) you and your Scripture.
